docs.snippet: After a deep slide in oil prices, Algeria's Sonatrach is shifting strategy to offer foreign firms direct negotiations to buy stakes in 20 oil and gas fields in a bid to attract investors and increase output, a source at the state energy company said.
docs.lead_paragraph: After a deep slide in oil prices, Algeria's Sonatrach is shifting strategy to offer foreign firms direct negotiations to buy stakes in 20 oil and gas fields in a bid to attract investors and increase output, a source at the state energy company said.

headline.main: Exclusive: Oil Revenues Down, Algeria Woos Energy Investors
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Oil Revenues Down, Algeria Woos Energy Investors

docs.snippet: The U.N. special envoy on Syria said he hoped a meeting between the U.S. and Russian foreign ministers on Wednesday would give impetus to peace talks where the divisive issue of a political transition is stalling progress.
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. special envoy on Syria said he hoped a meeting between the U.S. and Russian foreign ministers on Wednesday would give impetus to peace talks where the divisive issue of a political transition is stalling progress.

headline.main: U.N. Envoy Turns to U.S., Russia to Give Impetus to Syria Talks
headline.print_headline: U.N. Envoy Turns to U.S., Russia to Give Impetus to Syria Talks

docs.snippet: Ukrainian Finance Minister Natalia Yaresko threw her hat into the ring on Tuesday to head a technocrat government of people uncompromised by "a political past" after weeks of speculation over whether she would try to replace Arseny Yatseniuk.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukrainian Finance Minister Natalia Yaresko threw her hat into the ring on Tuesday to head a technocrat government of people uncompromised by "a political past" after weeks of speculation over whether she would try to replace Arseny Yatseniuk.

headline.main: Ukraine's Finance Minister Launches Bid to Lead Technocrat Government
headline.print_headline: Ukraine's Finance Minister Launches Bid to Lead Technocrat Government

docs.snippet: Uber, the high-flying transportation firm, is releasing a technical map of its computer and communications systems and inviting hackers to find weaknesses in exchange for cash bounties.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uber, the high-flying transportation firm, is releasing a technical map of its computer and communications systems and inviting hackers to find weaknesses in exchange for cash bounties.

headline.main: Uber Offers Hackers 'Treasure Map' to Find Computer Flaws
headline.print_headline: Uber Offers Hackers 'Treasure Map' to Find Computer Flaws

docs.snippet: Kyrgyzstan initiated a special meeting of a Russia-led regional security body on Tuesday to address tensions with its bigger neighbor Uzbekistan after a group of Uzbek armored vehicles and troops were deployed near their disputed border.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kyrgyzstan initiated a special meeting of a Russia-led regional security body on Tuesday to address tensions with its bigger neighbor Uzbekistan after a group of Uzbek armored vehicles and troops were deployed near their disputed border.

headline.main: Kyrgyzstan Turns to Russia-Led Security Body Over Incident With Uzbekistan
headline.print_headline: Kyrgyzstan Turns to Russia-Led Security Body Over Incident With Uzbekistan

docs.snippet: More than two months after international nuclear sanctions on Iran were supposed to have ended, frustration is deepening that few trade deals are going through as foreign banks shy away from processing transactions with the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than two months after international nuclear sanctions on Iran were supposed to have ended, frustration is deepening that few trade deals are going through as foreign banks shy away from processing transactions with the country.

headline.main: Iranians Exasperated as U.S. Sanctions Frustrate Deal Making
headline.print_headline: Iranians Exasperated as U.S. Sanctions Frustrate Deal Making

docs.snippet: The doubling of Anglo American's <AAL.l> share price since late January means the time could be ripe for a rights issue rather than an asset fire sale to boost its defenses against tumbling commodity prices, fund managers say.
docs.lead_paragraph: The doubling of Anglo American's <AAL.l> share price since late January means the time could be ripe for a rights issue rather than an asset fire sale to boost its defenses against tumbling commodity prices, fund managers say.

headline.main: Rise in Anglo American Share Price Could Offer Chance to Fill Its Coffers
headline.print_headline: Rise in Anglo American Share Price Could Offer Chance to Fill Its Coffers

docs.snippet: Syria said on Tuesday the attacks in Brussels were the "inevitable result of wrong policies and a tolerance for terrorism", and called for an international effort to confront the phenomenon.
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria said on Tuesday the attacks in Brussels were the "inevitable result of wrong policies and a tolerance for terrorism", and called for an international effort to confront the phenomenon.

headline.main: Syria Says 'Tolerance for Terrorism' Led to Brussels Attacks
headline.print_headline: Syria Says 'Tolerance for Terrorism' Led to Brussels Attacks

docs.snippet: Ford Motor Co will invest up to 200 million euros  ($224.28 million) to build its smaller sport utility vehicle EcoSport at its Romanian unit Automobile Craiova, Ford Europe Chief Executive Jim Farley said on Tuesday.
